intro: Cymopterus grayanus var. tenuifolius, commonly known as the slender-leafed scorpion weed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a taproot system and produces seeds in small, bract-like structures. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
